intro: Staudtia kamerunensis var. kamerunensis, commonly known as the Cameroon staudtia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical rainforests of West Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 1–2 meters, featuring upright stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, fragrant, white to pale yellow flowers during the wet season. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and requires partial to full shade for optimal growth. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
